intro: Alstonia roeperi, commonly known as the African star jasmine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its fragrant, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it its common name. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves that are dark green in color. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other ornamental and economically important plants. Alstonia roeperi is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
